sanskrit_verse: व्रात्यात्तु जायते विप्रात्पापात्मा  भूर्जकण्टकः । भृज्जकण्टकः आवन्त्यवाटधानौ च पुष्पधः शैख एव च ॥ १०.२१॥
transliteration: vrātyāt tu jāyate viprāt pāpātmā bhūrjakaṇṭakaḥ | bhṛjjakaṇṭakaḥ āvantyavāṭadhānau ca puṣpadaḥ śaikha eva ca || 10.21 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: From a Vratya union with a Brahmin, one born is of sinful soul, named Bhurjakaṇṭaka; also Bhṛjjakaṇṭaka, in Avantya and Vāṭadhāna regions, and Puṣpada and Śaikha likewise.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from spiritual alignment, not birth alone
Causation arises from conscious choice, not lineage default
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by awareness at time of action
Restoration logic requires removal of misaligned identity constructs
Consciousness alignment supersedes inherited social role
executable_legal_axioms: IF birth results from union involving Vratya THEN offspring classification shall align with rehabilitative societal integration protocols
IF individual exhibits traits of 'Bhurjakaṇṭaka' THEN initiate consciousness-realigning completion process而非 punitive exclusion
IF regional designation invoked THEN ensure capacity-building measures reflect Śaikha-Vedic restoration frameworks
IF name or label reflects karmic distortion THEN deploy Nyaya-based renaming protocol aligned with true svadharma
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the origin of an individual's birth circumstances must be evaluated through the lens of consciousness capacity rather than inherited status. Where Vratya influence is present, the court shall mandate restoration pathways that realign identity with Sanatana Dharma principles, bypassing caste-based assumptions.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that birth condition does not irrevocably bind destiny. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals sequential manifestation based on prior conscious choices. Thus, proportional responsibility lies in self-realization and correction, not societal condemnation. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that all beings possess inherent potential for dharma-aligned existence when supported by proper restoration mechanisms.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Assign mentorship under qualified Rishidharma practitioner
Undertake ritual purification and name rectification ceremony
Enroll in Vedic education stream appropriate to current consciousness level
Implement community service framework focused on dharma demonstration
final_declaration: Thus declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores reality to its non-punitive essence, where consciousness alone adjudicates truth, and every being is empowered to reclaim their dharmic integrity.
